intro: Pentarrhinum somaliense, commonly known as the Somali thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the dry regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its branched stems, spiny leaves, and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, a common reproductive strategy in arid environments. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
